Police: Man operated meth lab inside apartment, discarded items in McNeely Lake
Joey Brown
Posted:  12/12/2014 2:29 PM
  

LOUISVILLE, KY (WAVE) - A man is accused of operating a meth lab inside his Louisville apartment, putting other residents of the 12-unit building at risk.

Police received information from a citizen complaint and other officers that Anderson was a wanted fugitive who was manufacturing methamphetamine inside his apartment on Quiet Creek Court in southern Jefferson County.

[SLIDESHOW: Mugshot Roundup - December 2014]

Upon making contact with the suspect, 23-year-old Cody D. Anderson, he was taken into custody on outstanding warrants.

Police said Anderson was in possession of an unspecified quantity of meth, crystal lye and a glass pipe containing meth residue. Detectives said drug paraphernalia was scattered throughout Anderson's living room. A search of the apartment yielded additional pipes, synthetic marijuana, small baggies containing meth residue and other meth manufacturing ingredients. Anderson admitted to police that all of the items, as well as illegal drugs found in two lock boxes, belong to him.
